summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors. The indictment alleges that from approximately 1994 to 1997, Maxwell conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls as young as 14, and that she committed perjury in a 2016 civil deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell allegedly assisting him in recruiting, grooming, and abusing victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Alleged co-conspirators in a scheme to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity. Described as having a close personal and professional relationship, including an intimate relationship and Maxwell managing Epstein's properties.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, knowing of his sexual preference for underage girls and his intent to abuse them.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: The period during which Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave sworn deposition testimony in civil litigation (docket 15 Civ. 7344), during which she allegedly made false statements about her knowledge of Epstein's scheme and her interactions with minors.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave further sworn deposition testimony, during which she allegedly made false statements about her awareness of sex toys, Epstein's sexual activities with others, and whether she had given massages.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Interaction with Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch. Maxwell provided an unsolicited massage to the topless minor and encouraged her to massage Epstein.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) for Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 1997.

Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, denying awareness of sex toys, denying Epstein had other sexual partners, and denying she ever gave anyone a massage.
The alleged abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's London residence.
The indictment states Maxwell and Epstein used tactics like befriending victims, taking them shopping or to movies, discussing their lives, and normalizing sexual conduct to groom them for abuse.
